Parallel rqdatatable

John Mount

2018-06-08

Source: vignettes/Parallel_rqdatatable.Rmd
Parallel_rqdatatable.Rmd

One can try to execute relop trees in parallel. However, in unless the pipeline is very expensive the overhead of partitioning and distributing the work will by far overwhelm any parallel speedup. Also data.table itself already seems to exploit some thread-level parallelism (notice user time > elapsed time).

library("rqdatatable")
## Loading required package: rquery
cl <- parallel::makeCluster(2)
#parallel::clusterEvalQ(cl, library("rquery"))
#parallel::clusterEvalQ(cl, library("rqdatatable"))

set.seed(2362)
mk_example <- function(nkey, nrow, nrep = 5) {
  keys <- paste0("key_", seq_len(nkey))
  nrep <- 5
  key_table <- data.frame(
    key = rep(keys, 5),
    data = runif(nkey),
    stringsAsFactors = FALSE)
  instance_table <- data.frame(
    id = seq_len(nrow),
    key = sample(keys, nrow, replace = TRUE),
    group = sample(letters[1:9], nrow, replace = TRUE),
    info = runif(nrow),
    stringsAsFactors = FALSE)
  list(key_table = key_table,
       instance_table = instance_table)
}

dlist <- mk_example(20, 100)
data <- dlist$instance_table
annotation <- dlist$key_table


# possible data lookup: find rows that
# have lookup data <= info
optree <- local_td(data) %.>%
  natural_join(., local_td(annotation), jointype = "INNER", by = "key") %.>%
  select_rows_nse(., data <= info) %.>%
  pick_top_k(., 
             k = 1,
             partitionby = "id",
             orderby = "data",
             reverse = "data",
             keep_order_column = FALSE) %.>%
  orderby(., "id")
cat(format(optree))
## table('data'; 
##   id,
##   key,
##   group,
##   info) %.>%
##  natural_join(.,
##   table('annotation'; 
##     key,
##     data),
##   j= INNER, by= key) %.>%
##  select_rows(.,
##    data <= info) %.>%
##  extend(.,
##   row_rank := rank(),
##   p= id,
##   o= "data" DESC) %.>%
##  select_rows(.,
##    row_rank <= 1) %.>%
##  drop_columns(.,
##    row_rank) %.>%
##  orderby(., id)
res1 <- ex_data_table(optree)
head(res1)
##          data group id      info    key
## 1: 0.59951008     g  1 0.6772209 key_10
## 2: 0.32686536     h  2 0.9962857  key_6
## 3: 0.60960492     i  4 0.9477953  key_9
## 4: 0.03816097     h  7 0.2460344 key_14
## 5: 0.03816097     c  8 0.6926749 key_14
## 6: 0.38769091     a 10 0.5078290  key_2
nrow(res1)
## [1] 48
res2 <- ex_data_table_parallel(optree, "group", cl)
head(res2)
##          data group id      info    key
## 1: 0.59951008     g  1 0.6772209 key_10
## 2: 0.32686536     h  2 0.9962857  key_6
## 3: 0.60960492     i  4 0.9477953  key_9
## 4: 0.03816097     h  7 0.2460344 key_14
## 5: 0.03816097     c  8 0.6926749 key_14
## 6: 0.38769091     a 10 0.5078290  key_2
nrow(res2)
## [1] 48
dlist <- mk_example(10000, 10000, 10)
data <- dlist$instance_table
annotation <- dlist$key_table

system.time(ex_data_table(optree))
##    user  system elapsed 
##   0.102   0.013   0.046
system.time(ex_data_table_parallel(optree, "group", cl))
##    user  system elapsed 
##   0.189   0.047   0.476
parallel::stopCluster(cl)
rm(list = "cl")
